intro: Centaurea iconica, commonly known as the Iconic Centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and spiny, bristly leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in grasslands and scrublands. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its showy inflorescence. Centaurea iconica is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in poor soils.
